body_content.explanation: the salty water that covers a large part of the surface of the earth, or a large area of salty water, smaller than an ocean, that is partly or completely surrounded by land:
examples: We went swimming in the sea.
The sea was calm/smooth/choppy/rough when we crossed the Channel.
The refugees were at sea (= in a boat on the sea a long way from land) for 40 days before reaching land.
When we moved to the US, we sent our things by sea (= in a ship).
We spent a week by the sea (= on the coast) this year.
Soon we had left the marina and were heading towards the open sea (= the part of the sea a long way from land).

body_content.explanation: a large amount or number of something:
examples: The teacher looked down and saw a sea of smiling faces.

body_content.explanation: (of a ship) to leave a port and start a journey:
examples: The boats will put (out) to sea on this evening's high tide.

body_content.explanation: one of the large, flat areas on the moon that in the past were thought to be seas
